thread.title: New taxes hit soda, vending machines in Vermont
thread.title_full: New taxes hit soda, vending machines in Vermont

title: New taxes hit soda, vending machines in Vermont
text:
Soda drinkers, vending machine users face new Vermont taxes 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 7/4/15 10:23 am EDT - Updated: 7/4/15 10:25 am EDT 
BURLINGTON, Vermont â€” Vermonters who use vending machines or like soft drinks are having to fork over a bit more cash for those purchases. 
The state this week began applying its 6 percent sales tax to soft drinks and its 9 percent meals tax to vending machine purchases. 
At Kerry's Kwik Stop, owner Carrie Rockwood tells The Burlington Free Press ( http://bfpne.ws/1GUMBLC ) that "customers have been furious" about the tax on soft drinks. 
The levies are part of a package of tax increases lawmakers passed in May to raise $30 million in new revenue. The biggest changes were new limits on income tax deductions. 
The sales tax on soft drinks is expected to raise nearly $8 million a year. Applying the meals tax to vending machines is expected to raise about $1 million a year.
